revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Football club | clubname = Inter Primavera | fullname = | image = | ground = Centro Sportivo G.Facchetti, [[Milan]], [[Italy]] | capacity = | chrtitle = President | chairman =[[Massimo Moratti]] | mgrtitle = Head Coach | manager = Andrea Stramaccioni | league = [[Campionato Nazionale Primavera|Primavera]] | season = 2009â10 | position = Primavera Play-offs Round of 16 }} '''F.C. Internazionale Milano Primavera Team''' is the [[reserve team|Under-20 team]] of [[F.C. Internazionale Milano]], and plays in the [[Campionato Nazionale Primavera]]. Internazionale currently hold 6 League title, along with [[A.S. Roma]], 2 ''Scudetto'' short behind [[Torino F.C.|Torino]], now at [[Serie B]] but its youth team still at Campionato Primavera. Torino also hold 7 Primavera Cup title, while Inter ranked the 2nd with 5. Inter also entered the finals in 2002, 03, 04, 07 and 2008, which were 2002 and 2007 champions. The team never won [[Supercoppa Primavera]]. Despite ''Campionato Nazionale Primavera'' allowed to field players who turns age 20 in the calender year that the event closed in June, as well as a limited numbers of overage players, Inter often loaned the player out when the players turned age 19 in the calender year that the event starts, made the team ''de facto'' a U-19 team, matching the level of ''Allievi Nazionali'', which Inter also lower it from U-18 to U-17. For example, in 2010â11 season, forward [[Simone Dell'Agnello]], [[Francesco Bardi]], [[Simone Benedetti]] and [[Felice Natalino]] all eligible to 2011â12 ''Primavera'' season, but Inter found professional teams for the players. However, numbers of players remains despite turned age 20, likes [[Leonardo Bonucci]], [[Joel Obi]] who became a important backup of the first team in their final year with the youth team. ==Players== ===Current squad=== As of 29 September 2011.{{cite web|url=http://giovanili.inter.it/aas/squadra?IDS=1&L=en |title=PRIMAVERA |work=FC Internazionale Milano|publisher=Giovanili.inter.it |date=ca September 2011|accessdate=29 September 2011}} Squad number indicates first team number.{{cite news|url=http://www.legaseriea.it/c/document_library/get_file?uuid=12cb1401-80f3-440c-8a72-0688a3cdc333&groupId=10192|title=COMUNICATO STAMPA N. 3 DEL 4 AGOSTO 2011|work=Lega Serie A|language=Italian}}{{cite news|url=http://www.inter.it/aas/news/reader?N=37363&L=en|title=UEFA Champions League: Inter's squad list |date=1 September 2011|accessdate=29 September 2011|work=FC Internazionale Milano|publisher=www.inter.it|language=Italian}} {{Fs start}} {{Fs player|no=5|nat=Italy|pos=DF|name=Matteo Bianchetti}} {{Fs player|no=|nat=Italy|pos=MF|name=[[Lorenzo Crisetig]]}} {{Fs player|no=9|nat=Italy|pos=FW|name=Samuele Longo}}http://www.legaseriea.it/c/document_library/get_file?uuid=60f7d41a-be28-4bd3-b60a-0dafd5426f15&groupId=10192 {{Fs player|no=1|nat=Italy|pos=GK|name=Raffaele Di Gennaro}} {{Fs player|no=18|nat=Italy|pos=MF|name=Daniel Bessa}} {{Fs player|no=10|nat=Italy|pos=MF|name=Andrea RomanÃ²}} {{Fs player|no=13|nat=Czech Republic|pos=DF|name=Marek Kysela}} {{Fs player|no=96|nat=Italy|pos=FW|name=Giovanni Terrani}} {{Fs player|no=|nat=Portugal|pos=FW|name=Bocar Djumo}} {{Fs player|no=12|nat=Italy|pos=GK|name=Matteo Cincilla}} {{Fs player|no=|nat=Italy|pos=GK|name=Riccardo Melgrati}} {{Fs player|no=|nat=Italy|pos=GK|name=Andrea Sala|other=on loan from [[Aurora Pro Patria 1919|Pro Patria]]}} {{cite web|url=http://www.inter.it/aas/news/reader?L=it&N=53380&stringa= |title=F.C.
